title: Three charged with assaulting officers during Jan. 6 riots, court docs say
body: Three men face varying charges after federal officials say they assaulted two law enforcement officers during the January 6 riots at the U.S. Capitol, according to a 13-count indictment filed by the U.S. Department of Justice.Albuquerque Cosper Head, 41, of Kingsport, Tennessee; Kyle James Young, 37, of Redfield, Iowa; and Thomas Sibick, 35, of Buffalo, New York, were indicted Friday, facing charges for participating in the riots at the Capitol, as well as assaulting DC Police Officer Michael Fanone and an unidentified U.S. Capitol Police officer.According to the Department of Justice, some of the charges include:The filing said Head, Young, and Sibick assaulted two officers, identified as M.F. and M.M., during the events on Jan. 6, where hundreds stormed the Capitol steps in an attempt to stop Congress from certifying the 2020 Presidential election results. The event turned violent as those leaving the Stop the Steal rally turned into rioters, breaking windows to get into the Capitol building and attacking law enforcement that got in their way.Authorities charged Sibick in March for his conduct that day, charging him not only with assault but with robbery as well. A federal complaint said the New York man attacked Officer Michael Fanone and took his badge with him. Officer Fanone described the horrifying moments to 7News a week after the riots, saying someone yelled "Kill him with his own gun" at one point during the assault.Fanone was treated that night for having a heart attack.Sibick was arrested in February after federal authorities say he first claimed he was trying to assist the officer during the riot.FBI agents arrested Young and Head in Iowa and Tennessee, respectively, earlier this week.    by  on Scribd
